metadata.title: CVE-2015-2753 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
FreeXL before 1.0.0i allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(stack corruption) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted sectorin a workbook.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2753` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libfreexl1 - 1.0.0h-1~exp1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freexl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.0h-1~exp1ubuntu1').
